Class Piece

java.lang.Object
  Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends Object

A Piece is an object that can be placed on the chess board.
The implementation of this class is testable on the AP CS AB exam.

Version:
May 5, 2017
Author:
Alyce Brady, APCS Development Committee, Cay Horstmann, Anu Datar, Alex Yu

Constructor Summary
Piece(Color col, String fileName, int val)
          Constructs a new Piece with a color, value and image information.

abstract  ArrayList<Location> destinations()
          Returns the valid destinations for this piece.

          Returns the board this piece is on.

Constructor Detail

Piece

public Piece(Color col,
             String fileName,
             int val)
Constructs a new Piece with a color, value and image information.

Parameters:
col - color of the piece
fileName - the image file name for piece
val - the weight for the piece
Method Detail

destinations

public abstract ArrayList<Location> destinations()
Returns the valid destinations for this piece.

Returns:
an ArrayList of all valid destinations

getBoard

public Board getBoard()
Returns the board this piece is on.

Returns:
the board this piece belongs to

getColor

public Color getColor()
Returns the color of this piece.

Returns:
the color this piece belongs to on the board

getImageFileName

public String getImageFileName()
Returns the name of the file used to display this piece.

Returns:
the file name for this piece

getLocation

public Location getLocation()
Returns the location of this piece on the board.

Returns:
the location this piece belongs to on the board

getOrigin

public Location getOrigin()

getValue

public int getValue()
Returns a number representing the relative value of this piece.

Returns:
the value of this piece

isValidDestination

public boolean isValidDestination(Location dest)
Checks if the given location is in the board and if the piece can move there.

Parameters:
dest - the location to check
Returns:
true if the given location is a valid destination for the piece; otherwise, false

moveTo

public void moveTo(Location newLocation)
Moves this piece to a new location. If there is another piece at the given location, it is removed.

Precondition:
(1) this piece is contained in a grid (2) newLocation is valid in the grid of this piece
Parameters:
newLocation - the new location

putSelfInGrid

public void putSelfInGrid(Board brd,
                          Location loc)
Puts this piece into a board. If there is another piece at the given location, it is removed.

Precondition:
(1) this piece is not contained in a grid (2) loc is valid in gr
Parameters:
brd - the board into which this piece should be placed
loc - the location into which the piece should be placed

removeSelfFromGrid

public void removeSelfFromGrid()
Removes this piece from its board.

Precondition:
this piece is contained in a board

sweep

public void sweep(ArrayList<Location> dests,
                  int direction)
Adds all valid destinations directly in front of this piece to an ArrayList of Locations.

Parameters:
dests - the ArrayList to fill with valid destinations
direction - the current direction the piece is facing
